question:
In light of the recent observation of the National Youth Day, consider the following statements about Swami Vivekananda:
  1. He was a proponent of Neo- Vedanta.
  2. India had released a commemorative stamp on Vivekananda with Serbia.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: Swami Vivekananda was a well known proponent of Neo- Vedanta. It is noted as a universalistic interpretation of Hinduism and is also called Hindu Universalism. Other proponents include Mahatma Gandhi, Radhakrishnan (the 2nd president of India) and Aurobindo (an Indian philosopher). Statement 2 is correct: In 2018, India and Serbia had jointly released a commemorative stamp on Swami Vivekananda. The birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda (January 12th) is observed as the National Youth Day in India. The 2020 edition of the celebration is to be on the theme of ‘Fit Youth Fit India’.
